China: Shengzong died.  He was succeeded by his son Emperor Xingzong of Liao.
France: Robert died in a civil war against his sons.  His second son, Henry I, succeeded him; his third, Robert I Capet, disputed the succession and led a new revolt.
Spain: Hisham III of Córdoba, the caliph of Córdoba in exile, was overthrown and his title abolished by the local nobility, resulting in the immediate de jure independence of the taifas of Al-Andalus.
